chipram.title: Chip RAM
chipram.desc: Pulsing memory banks stretch in all directions. Data flows through copper traces like rivers of light. A strange artifact glows in the corner.

items.guru: A Guru Meditation crystal, pulsing with red light.

looks.guru: The crystal throbs: "Software Failure. Press left mouse button to continue."

cli.title: CLI Window
cli.desc: A blinking cursor awaits your command. Stacks of floppy disks line the WEST wall. A directory listing scrolls NORTH into darkness.

copper.title: Copper List
copper.desc: Rainbow color bars cascade down around you in perfect sync. A shimmering portal to the EAST crackles with energy. It seems to demand something powerful to activate.

EAST.msg: The portal flickers but won't open. It needs a source of power.

looks.portal: Swirling colors form and dissolve. You can almost see another world beyond.

demoscene.title: The Demo Scene
demoscene.desc: You've reached the legendary Demo Scene! Scrolling text congratulates you as impossible 3D graphics render in real-time on custom hardware. Chiptune music fills the air. You have won! Type QUIT to return to the Workbench.

directory.title: File Directory
directory.desc: Rows of files sorted alphabetically stretch in every direction. Folders nest within folders like fractal geometry. A locked door leads EAST to the system folder.

EAST.msg: The door requires system access. You need the right disk.

looks.door: A heavy steel door with a disk slot beside it.

start.title: Workbench Desktop
start.desc: You are on the Amiga Workbench desktop. Icons float around you like pixelated constellations. A CLI window glows to the NORTH. The trash can sits to the EAST.

looks.manual: The cover reads "AmigaDOS Inside & Out" - looks well-thumbed.

system.title: System Folder
system.desc: The heart of the operating system hums around you. Fonts, libs, and devs pulse with quiet energy. A ladder leads UP into the chip architecture.

trash.title: Trash Can
trash.desc: Mountains of deleted files surround you. Broken icons and corrupted data crunch underfoot. Something glints in the pile.

items.disk: A slightly scratched floppy disk labeled "KEY".

looks.disk: The label reads "System Access v1.0" in faded marker.
